replies.msg: 唔比攬先係正常嘅主子

My friend Joe was born in 1993.He's faithful to his girlfriend and would never cheat on her.When he broke up with his ex, he was pushed to the edge.Even when a stranger talked to him there was an edge of hostility to his voice.But as soon as he had a new relationship target it took the edge of his emotional upset.His ex is a swimming champion who easily outshines mr and him.She is tall and curvy who definitely has the edge over lots of swimmers.Recently joe got into a brawl with a guy who was hitting on his girlfriend.The police showed up later and assigned jealousy as the motive for the brawl.A couple days ago, they signed at a restaurant in a hotel which is midway between his house and the post office.They stood in line outside the hotel for almost an hour. The line was so huge that it stretched from the counter through the lobby area and out the main entrance of the hotel.A stout man tried to cut in line but was caught.Yesterday I popped over to their place and visited them.The bus queue was so big stretching down the road to the furthest mini bus stop.I queued for half an hour till three shuttle buses came along at once.Meanwhile some people mistook this long queue for the queue for other places. A couple came up to me and asked "are you in the queue for Cluny Park?"to be sure that it's the right queue. A stout guy pushed in at the head of the queue but people ignored it. Later a slender man jumped the queue. The lady behind him said "excuse me. The end of the queue is back there" A woman stood beside a guy who was midway through the queue. While pretending to look at her phone she edged furtively behind him who didn't realise she was there. Some people might have noticed it but ignored it. When I saw joe he seemed on edge. It turns out he has a job interview tomorrow. Never has he felt so on edge before an interview. Hos elder brother is currently a head chef at a five star hotel and feels he's found his niche. His younger brother too has found his niche as a professor having worked as a researcher for three years. His eldest brother sometimes has a snooze at lunchtime as he has so much work to do that he feels drained. He usually naps on the sofa or at his desk by the fireplace when everybody else's eating lunch outside.He once brought his work.along to the library where he dozed off at the table.Having a doze especially in front of the fire is a marvelous way to replenish your energy though.His eldest sister is robust and healthy.She does lots of strength and conditioning exercises in her robust sneakers.After her gym session she usually drinks a cup of robust coffee and a glass of robust wine. She lives in japan where the political system and economy are robust. His elder sis has just completed her phd at Tokyo university and is on the way to becoming a professor.Japan is on the way to becoming the world's strongest economy.His uncle has recently passed away at the age of ninety. I offer my sincere condolences to his uncle's family. His friend Jen wrote "my condolences on the loss of your uncle" His mum sent her condolences to his uncke's family too.His dad also wrote "our condolences go to his family" By the way he hadnt heard from his cousin for years until yesterday he received a call from her.They chatted in exquisite delight. Joe lives on The Peak and owns many houses. Unlike Maywearger he's never ostentatious though extremely wealthy.You can find out how ostentatious Mayweather's lifestyle is.He always wears ostentatious jewellery.such as silver necklaces, gold rings and bracelets.He loves driving flashy cars and wearing flashy clothes. Do you remember the incident happened in Langham Place where the escalator stopped and reversed direction at a speed two to three times as fast as normal causing people to fall and pile up at the base of the escalator?People were screaming as they tumbled down the escalator.Some people managed to grab the handrail and steady themselves.The incident occasioned a good deal of worry.

quote.msg: My friend Joe was born in 1993.He's faithful to his girlfriend and would never cheat on her.When he broke up with his ex, he was pushed to the edge.Even when a stranger talked to him there was an edge of hostility to his voice.But as soon as he had a new relationship target it took the edge of his emotional upset.His ex is a swimming champion who easily outshines mr and him.She is tall and curvy who definitely has the edge over lots of swimmers.Recently joe got into a brawl with a guy who was hitting on his girlfriend.The police showed up later and assigned jealousy as the motive for the brawl.A couple days ago, they signed at a restaurant in a hotel which is midway between his house and the post office.They stood in line outside the hotel for almost an hour. The line was so huge that it stretched from the counter through the lobby area and out the main entrance of the hotel.A stout man tried to cut in line but was caught.Yesterday I popped over to their place and visited them.The bus queue was so big stretching down the road to the furthest mini bus stop.I queued for half an hour till three shuttle buses came along at once.Meanwhile some people mistook this long queue for the queue for other places. A couple came up to me and asked "are you in the queue for Cluny Park?"to be sure that it's the right queue. A stout guy pushed in at the head of the queue but people ignored it. Later a slender man jumped the queue. The lady behind him said "excuse me. The end of the queue is back there" A woman stood beside a guy who was midway through the queue. While pretending to look at her phone she edged furtively behind him who didn't realise she was there. Some people might have noticed it but ignored it. When I saw joe he seemed on edge. It turns out he has a job interview tomorrow. Never has he felt so on edge before an interview. Hos elder brother is currently a head chef at a five star hotel and feels he's found his niche. His younger brother too has found his niche as a professor having worked as a researcher for three years. His eldest brother sometimes has a snooze at lunchtime as he has so much work to do that he feels drained. He usually naps on the sofa or at his desk by the fireplace when everybody else's eating lunch outside.He once brought his work.along to the library where he dozed off at the table.Having a doze especially in front of the fire is a marvelous way to replenish your energy though.His eldest sister is robust and healthy.She does lots of strength and conditioning exercises in her robust sneakers.After her gym session she usually drinks a cup of robust coffee and a glass of robust wine. She lives in japan where the political system and economy are robust. His elder sis has just completed her phd at Tokyo university and is on the way to becoming a professor.Japan is on the way to becoming the world's strongest economy.His uncle has recently passed away at the age of ninety. I offer my sincere condolences to his uncle's family. His friend Jen wrote "my condolences on the loss of your uncle" His mum sent her condolences to his uncke's family too.His dad also wrote "our condolences go to his family" By the way he hadnt heard from his cousin for years until yesterday he received a call from her.They chatted in exquisite delight. Joe lives on The Peak and owns many houses. Unlike Maywearger he's never ostentatious though extremely wealthy.You can find out how ostentatious Mayweather's lifestyle is.He always wears ostentatious jewellery.such as silver necklaces, gold rings and bracelets.He loves driving flashy cars and wearing flashy clothes. Do you remember the incident happened in Langham Place where the escalator stopped and reversed direction at a speed two to three times as fast as normal causing people to fall and pile up at the base of the escalator?People were screaming as they tumbled down the escalator.Some people managed to grab the handrail and steady themselves.The incident occasioned a good deal of worry.

replies.msg: My friend Sue was born in 1990 while his boyfriend was born in 1992. Her auntie opened an antique shop which created a favorable impression on me. Theres an exquisite antique that engages my interest. I'll bet the shop engages lots of passers-by. I had a favorable impression of the shop.When you were in secondary school were there any subjects that you weren't interested in and so didn't engage much during the classes?I remember I didn't engage much during geography classes.I was often daydreaming.Sue loves video games.I remember her playing Counterstrike in which she used a gun to single-handedly engage ninety nine enemies who only had knives lol.Im reading a book called.Parallel Worlds written by physicist Kaku.When he was explaining the theories promoting the book on a television show it captured my imagination.It's a fascinating book which explores the science of time travel, wormholes, eleven dimensional hyperspace and parallel universes, subjects that engage numerous reader's attentionIt was an international bestseller for many monthsSue told me that there was a bully in her class at university.I told her not to engage with herJust stay out of her way as much as possibleNowadays many students learn violin, piano, dancing, painting, judo and Japanese.I honestly.don't know how they juggle schoolwork with these activitiesSome of their parents have to work and so find it hard to juggle a career and a familyPerhaps they want to kindle their kids' interests and see which one they have a talent for or can cultivate an interest inSometimes I wonder if the children are truly enjoying their activities.I remember a decade ago there was a protest where the protestors clashed with the police in osaka.I saw it on NHK then.I thought the police were not tough enoughAll the riot police were holding a shield in one hand and a baton in the other hand.In this way you can't really fight the protestors and arrest them since you have no free hands to grant ahold of them. That's why it took four policemen to catch ahold of one demonstrator.From a fighting perspective some.of the riot police should be holding just a shield, some just a truncheon, the other both.And all of them should be trained as to how they fight when they're holding just a shield, holding just a nightstick and holding both.It was a catastrophe.I didn't think Osaka had ever been so chaotic before.The police who I wholeheartedly supported only used tear gas in an attempt to drive the protestors away which was clearly not enough.The police shouldn't be afraid of being criticized for using excessive force because it was utterly not the case.Firing rubber bullets and bean bags at the protestors was necessary lawful and appropriate.Those who sabotaged the nearby buildings and the railings should've been sent to jail.The train network was paralyzed by the strikes for weeks.The world had brought the city to the edge of a catastrophe.The united states had already imposed trade sanctions on japan.The then US president said he would take punitive measures against japan if the police there used excessive force.Japan was afraid that America would toughen punitive import duties still further on alcohol, clothes,agricultural products and food and worse still they would convince the other nations to impose international economic sanctions against the country.Of course the downside was the costs of the products in America which they'd imposed punitive import tariffs on would rise.stiol higher.The economic sanctions against japan wouldn't be lifted until the then united states president's presidency expired a year later.The next day everyone was.warned of the danger of violent clashes only to discover that it was a false alarm.There were half as many people in the street.However if you followed the news and stayed away from places where there were demonstrations it was safe in osaka.on thr same day a bus crash killed ten passengers.Detectives assigned the blame for the accident to a hailstorm.
